work.summary: Research Intern under Professor Ahmed Kaky
highlights: Worked on Music Emotion Recognition problem with a three-way approach constituting time, frequency and time-frequency domain audio features as inputs to Deep Neural Networks to identify emotions in a given musical clip.
Curated dataset with Musical compositions using audio processing techniques and tools such as Audacity, SonicVisualizer and extracted various time-series and audio-visual representation of data.

Performed evaluation of numerous Deep learning models involving CNNs, LSTMs, BiLSTMs and transfer learning models like VGGNet19. The best results achieved make use of combined features in frequency and time domain with accuracy of 84% and visual-representations of audio signal reaching high AUC of 97% on the test data.

work.summary: Software Engineer - System Validation and Integration Group
highlights: Worked as a domain lead in the Windows System Validation and Integration team for the Storage and Memory sub domains that involves enabling latest technology features in Intelâ€™s Processers (AlderLake).
Responsible for supervising test execution teams and driving a clear plan for latest technology features enablements such as Optane, Two-Level Memory.

Worked on Quality Initiatives for System Validation teams using NLP techniques to develop a domain classifier model that reduces manual intervention in assigning defects raised on issues platform to the teams based on past textual data assignments.

work.summary: Firmware Development - Modem Signal Processing and Control
highlights: Developed and owned UE Physical layer features for 4G/5G RAT, working primarily on power management, cell search/measurement, resource allocation management for master and slave RATs.

Owned independently the In Device Coexistence (IDC) module to handle cellular communications (LTE-FDD, LTE-TDD, 2G, 3G and TD-SCDMA) simultaneously with connectivity communications (WLAN, BT and GNSS) by supporting coexistence filter switching feature in the RF interface.

Maintenance of dual sim dynamic RF resource allocation algorithms (e.g. TRX, analog and digital RF chain, DigRF instances and configuration) in L1CC via a DigRF resource manager interface and handling of RF conflicts.
Responsible for code maintenance and defect debugging for features owned.
Performed and evaluated Profiling for Code Optimization and MIPS Reduction for the L1CC core to support 5CA use cases in XMM7560.
Knowledge of 3GPP Technical specification (TS 36.xxx, TS 38.xxx) and system procedures.
Technical interface experience with customer technical team, sub component teams and field engineers.
